alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 10 at 9:21PM PST until December 11 at 2:07AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish will continue to slowly recede tonight into Monday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. No flooding is currently forecast by Monday morning. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Skokomish River will locally spill over its banks into low-lying areas of the Skokomish Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM PST Sunday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - The river crested at 16.6 feet around noon Sunday. - Forecast...The river will continue to slowly recede tonight into Monday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 215 AM PST.
